intro: Psychotria medica, commonly known as the "medicinal psychotria," is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It contains various alkaloids, including psychotrine, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties. Due to its medicinal uses and ecological significance, it is often found in humid, shaded forest environments.
